page.title: 18RECREATION.
page.content: { KNOSSINGTON & OWSTON LEISURE Most people indulge in one or more outdoor leisure activity: gardening, beekeeping, riding, walking, fishing, shooting, hunting, scrambling, birdwatching or cricket. The Cottesmore Hunt meets regularly in the area and the Knossington cricket field is on the road to Owston. All houses have gardens which are well kept and several families own a green house and/or stables. People belong to clubs and societies according to their intrests, in neighbouring villages and towns. Six of the women belong to the Knossington Women's Institute and sewing, knitting , lacemaking, chess, reading, music and other indoor activities are pursued. The village hall is available for parties and discos. It is used by children in the school holidays.
